question: Which of the following is a pneumatic bone -
exp: Ans. is 'c' i.e., Mastoid process o Pneumatic bones are one which contain large air spaces lined by epithelium. Examples: maxilla, sphenoid, ethmoid, etc. They make the skull light in weight, help in resonance of voice, and act as air conditioning chambers for the inspired air.o A bone that is hollow or contains many air cells called as penumatic bone.o Examples are mastoid process of temporal bone, maxilla, ethmoid, sphlenoid and frontal bone. Very simple to remember last 4 as all four paransal sinuses are pneumatic bones.
topic_name: Anatomy and Physiology of Nose and PNS

question: Which of the following is not a function of nose?
exp: ANSWER: (B) Air pressure controlREF: Dhingra 4th ed page 133Functions of the nose are classified as:1. Respiration2. Air conditioning of inspired aira. Filtration and purificationb. Temperature control of the inspired airc. HumidificationProtection of lower airwayMucociliary mechanismSecretion of Enzymes and immunoglobulinsSneezingVocal resonanceNasal reflex functions: Smell of a palatable food cause reflex secretion of saliva and gastric juice. Irritation of nasal mucosa causes sneezing .Olfaction
